alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 25 at 2:49AM CDT until July 25 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: .Torrential rains are possible across far southeast Iowa, west central Illinois, and far northeast Missouri beginning this evening into tonight as a frontal boundary sets up over the area. Very high amounts of moisture will combine with the front and a passing disturbance aloft to produce very heavy rain amounts. Rainfall totals of 1-3 inches will be possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of west central Illinois, southeast Iowa and northeast Missouri, including the following counties, in west central Illinois, Hancock and McDonough. In southeast Iowa, Lee. In northeast Missouri, Clark and Scotland. * WHEN...From this evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
